info.title: TwitterAPI.io the most stable/fastest/cheapest twitter api.
info.description: Provide the most stable/fastest/cheapest twitter api.

get.description: Get unser info by screen name

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: The screen name of the user

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: Get trends by woeid

parameters.name: woeid
parameters.description: The woeid of the location. eg. 2418046. Woeid list: https://gist.github.com/tedyblood/5bb5a9f78314cc1f478b3dd7cde790b9

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of trends to return. Default is 30. Min is 30.

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description:
Batch get user info by user ids. Pricing:

- Single user request: 18 credits per user
- Bulk request (100+ users): 10 credits per user

Note: For cost optimization, we recommend batching requests when fetching multiple user profiles.

parameters.name: userIds
parameters.description: The user ids to get.eg. 1234567890,1234567891,1234567892. Use comma to separate multiple user ids

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: Retrieve tweets by user name.Sort by created_at. Results are paginated, with each page returning up to 20 tweets.This API will not return the tweets the user replied to. If you want to get the reply tweets, please use the advanced search API.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: user id of the user.userId is recommended, could be more stable and faster than userName.userId and userName are mutually exclusive. If both are provided, userId will be used.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: screen name of the user.userId and userName are mutually exclusive. If both are provided, userId will be used.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to paginate through the results. First page is "".

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: get tweet by tweet ids

parameters.name: tweet_ids
parameters.description: The tweet ids to get.eg. 1846987139428634858,1866332309399781537,1868244766405870076. Use comma to separate multiple tweet ids

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: get tweet replies by tweet id.Each page returns exactly 20 replies. Use cursor for pagination. Order by reply time desc

parameters.name: tweetId
parameters.description: The tweet ID to get. Must be an original tweet (not a reply to another tweet) and should be the first tweet in a thread.. eg. 1846987139428634858

parameters.name: sinceTime
parameters.description: On or after a specified unix timestamp in seconds.

parameters.name: untilTime
parameters.description: Before a specified unix timestamp in seconds.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to paginate through the results. First page is "".

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available. If true, use next_cursor to fetch the next page. Warning: Due to Twitter API inconsistency, has_more might return true even when no additional data exists. In such cases, subsequent requests will return empty results - this is a known platform limitation.

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: Get the thread context of a tweet.Suppose a tweet thread consists of t1, t2 (replying to t1), t3 (replying to t2), and t4, t5, t6 (all replying to t3). If we provide an API where you input t3 and receive t1, t2, t3, t4, t5, t6.Pagination is supported.The pagination size cannot be set (due to Twitter's limitations), and the data returned per page is not fixed.

parameters.name: tweetId
parameters.description: The tweet ID to get. Can be a reply tweet or a original tweet.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to paginate through the results. First page is "".

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available. If true, use next_cursor to fetch the next page. Warning: Due to Twitter API inconsistency, has_more might return true even when no additional data exists. In such cases, subsequent requests will return empty results - this is a known platform limitation.

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: get tweet quotes by tweet id.Each page returns exactly 20 quotes. Use cursor for pagination. Order by quote time desc

parameters.name: tweetId
parameters.description: The tweet ID to get. eg. 1846987139428634858

parameters.name: sinceTime
parameters.description: On or after a specified unix timestamp in seconds.

parameters.name: untilTime
parameters.description: Before a specified unix timestamp in seconds.

parameters.name: includeReplies
parameters.description: Whether to include replies in the results. Default is True.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to paginate through the results. First page is "".

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available. If true, use next_cursor to fetch the next page. Warning: Due to Twitter API inconsistency, has_more might return true even when no additional data exists. In such cases, subsequent requests will return empty results - this is a known platform limitation.

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: The user screen name to get. eg. kaitoEasyApi

parameters.name: sinceTime
parameters.description: On or after a specified unix timestamp in seconds.

parameters.name: untilTime
parameters.description: Before a specified unix timestamp in seconds.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to paginate through the results. First page is "".

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available. If true, use next_cursor to fetch the next page. Warning: Due to Twitter API inconsistency, has_more might return true even when no additional data exists. In such cases, subsequent requests will return empty results - this is a known platform limitation.

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: get tweets by list id.Each page returns exactly 20 tweets. Use cursor for pagination. Order by tweet time desc

parameters.name: sinceTime
parameters.description: On or after a specified unix timestamp in seconds.

parameters.name: untilTime

parameters.name: includeReplies
parameters.description: Whether to include replies in the results. Default is True.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to paginate through the results. First page is "".

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available. If true, use next_cursor to fetch the next page. Warning: Due to Twitter API inconsistency, has_more might return true even when no additional data exists. In such cases, subsequent requests will return empty results - this is a known platform limitation.

get.description: get tweet retweeters by tweet id.Each page returns about 100 retweeters. Use cursor for pagination. Order by retweet time desc

parameters.description: The tweet ID to get. eg. 1846987139428634858

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to paginate through the results. First page is "".

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available. If true, use next_cursor to fetch the next page. Warning: Due to Twitter API inconsistency, has_more might return true even when no additional data exists. In such cases, subsequent requests will return empty results - this is a known platform limitation.

get.description: Get user followers in reverse chronological order (newest first). Returns exactly 200 followers per page, sorted by follow date. Most recent followers appear on the first page. Use cursor for pagination through the complete followers list.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: screen name of the user

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to paginate through the results. First page is "".

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: Get user followings. Each page returns exactly 200 followings. Use cursor for pagination.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: screen name of the user

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to paginate through the results. First page is "".

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: Check if the user is following/followed by the target user. Trial operation price: 100 credits per call.

parameters.name: source_user_name
parameters.description: screen name of the source user

parameters.name: target_user_name
parameters.description: screen name of the target user

following.description: Whether the source user is following the target user

followed_by.description: Whether the source user is followed by the target user

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: Advanced search for tweets.Each page returns exactly about 20 tweets. Use cursor for pagination.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to search for.eg.  "AI"  OR "Twitter" from:elonmusk since:2021-12-31_23:59:59_UTC . Get more examples from https://github.com/igorbrigadir/twitter-advanced-search

parameters.name: queryType
parameters.description: The query type to search for.eg.  "Latest"  OR "Top"

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to paginate through the results. First page is "".

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

post.description: Login Step 1: by email or username.Recommend to use email.Trial operation price: $0.003 per call.

username_or_email.description: The email or username of the user

hint.description: Hint of the login.eg. "Please use second endpoint /login_2fa to continue login."

login_data.description: Use this data to call /twitter/login_2fa to continue login.

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

post.description: Login Step 2: by 2fa code.Trial operation price: $0.003 per call.

session.description: The session of the login.Use this session to call other endpoints.eg. /twitter/create_tweet /twitter/like_tweet

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

user.description: The user info of the login.

screen_name.description: The screen name of the user

post.description: Create a tweet.Need to login first.Trial operation price: $0.001 per call.

auth_session.description: The session of the login. It's returned by /twitter/login_by_2fa

quote_tweet_id.description: The id of the tweet to quote.Optional

in_reply_to_tweet_id.description: The id of the tweet to reply to.Optional

media_id.description: The id of the media to attach.Optional

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

post.description: Like a tweet.Need to login first. Trial operation price: $0.001 per call.

auth_session.description: The session of the login. It's returned by /twitter/login_by_2fa

tweet_id.description: The id of the tweet to like

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

post.description: add member to a list.Need to login first. Trial operation price: $0.001 per call.

auth_session.description: The session of the login. It's returned by /twitter/login_by_2fa

user_id.description: The id of the user to add.user_id and user_name must be set at least one.

user_name.description: The name of the user to add.user_id and user_name must be set at least one.

proxy.description: The proxy to use.Optional,but recommend to set.

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

post.description: remove member from a list.Need to login first. Trial operation price: $0.001 per call.

auth_session.description: The session of the login. It's returned by /twitter/login_by_2fa

user_id.description: The id of the user to add.user_id and user_name must be set at least one.

user_name.description: The name of the user to add.user_id and user_name must be set at least one.

proxy.description: The proxy to use.Optional,but recommend to set.

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

post.description: upload image to twitter.Need to login first. Trial operation price: $0.001 per call.

auth_session.description: The session of the login. It's returned by /twitter/login_by_2fa

image_url.description: The url of the image to upload

proxy.description: The proxy to use.Optional,but recommend to set.

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

media_id.description: The id of the uploaded image

delete.description: Deletes a single plant based on the ID supplied

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of plant to delete

get.description: Get all tweet filter rules.Rule can be used in webhook and websocket.You can also modify the rule in our web page.

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

post.description: Add a tweet filter rule. Default rule is not activated.You must call update_rule to activate the rule.

tag.description: Custom tag to identify the rule.Must be set.Max length is 255

value.description: Rule to filter tweets.eg "from:elonmusk OR from:kaitoeasyapi".Must be set.Max length is 255

interval_seconds.description: Interval to check tweets.Must be set.Min value is 100.Max value is 86400 ()

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

post.description: Update a tweet filter rule. You must set all parameters.

rule_id.description: ID of the rule to update.Must be set

tag.description: Custom tag to identify the rule.Must be set.Max length is 255

value.description: Rule to filter tweets.eg "from:elonmusk OR from:kaitoeasyapi".Must be set.Max length is 255

interval_seconds.description: Interval to check tweets.Must be set.Min value is 0.1.Max value is 86400 ()

is_effect.description: Whether the rule is effective.Must be set.1 means effective, 0 means not effective.Default value is 0

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

delete.description: Delete a tweet filter rule. You must set all parameters.

rule_id.description: ID of the rule to delete.Must be set

status.description: Status of the request.success or error

get.description: Get community info by community id. Price: 20 credits per call. Note: This API is a bit slow, we are still optimizing it.

parameters.name: community_id
parameters.description: id of the community

member_count.description: Number of members in the community

moderator_count.description: Number of moderators in the community

items.description: Member information with same structure as creator

status.description: Status of the request: success or error

msg.description: Message of the request, error message if status is error

get.description: Get members of a community. Page size is 20.

parameters.name: community_id
parameters.description: id of the community

status.description: Status of the request: success or error

msg.description: Message of the request, error message if status is error

get.description: Get moderators of a community. Page size is 20.

parameters.name: community_id
parameters.description: id of the community

status.description: Status of the request: success or error

msg.description: Message of the request, error message if status is error

get.description: Get tweets of a community. Page size is 20. Order by creation time desc.

parameters.name: community_id
parameters.description: id of the community

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: cursor of the page

has_next.description: Whether there is a next page

status.description: Status of the request: success or error

msg.description: Message of the request, error message if status is error

get.description: Get members of a list. Page size is 20.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: id of the list

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: cursor of the page

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

status.description: Status of the request: success or error

msg.description: Message of the request, error message if status is error

get.description: Get followers of a list. Page size is 20.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: id of the list

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: cursor of the page

has_next_page.description: Indicates if there are more results available

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

status.description: Status of the request: success or error

msg.description: Message of the request, error message if status is error

userName.description: The username of the Twitter user

url.description: The x.com URL of the user's profile

id.description: The unique identifier of the user

name.description: The display name of the user

isBlueVerified.description: Whether the user has Twitter Blue verification

verifiedType.description: The type of verification. eg. "government" ,can be empty

profilePicture.description: URL of the user's profile picture

coverPicture.description: URL of the user's cover picture

location.description: The user's location.for example:  . may be empty

canDm.description: Whether the user can receive DMs

createdAt.description: When the account was created.for example: Thu Dec 13 08:41:26 +0000 2007

hasCustomTimelines.description: Whether the user has custom timelines

isTranslator.description: Whether the user is a translator

withheldInCountries.description: Countries where the account is withheld

possiblySensitive.description: Whether the account may contain sensitive content

automatedBy.description: The account that automated the account

message.description: The message of the account.eg. "This account is unavailable" or "This account is suspended"

unavailableReason.description: The reason the account is unavailable.eg. "suspended"

query.description: The query of the target. eg. "#elonmusk"

meta_description.description: The meta description of the trend.eg. "17.7K posts".may be empty.

source.description: The source of the tweet.eg. "Twitter for iPhone"

retweetCount.description: The number of times the tweet has been retweeted

replyCount.description: The number of times the tweet has been replied to

likeCount.description: The number of times the tweet has been liked

quoteCount.description: The number of times the tweet has been quoted

viewCount.description: The number of times the tweet has been viewed

createdAt.description: The date and time the tweet was created.eg. Tue Dec 10 07:00:30 +0000 2024

lang.description: The language of the tweet.eg. "en".may be empty

bookmarkCount.description: The number of times the tweet has been bookmarked

isReply.description: Indicates if the tweet is a reply

inReplyToId.description: The ID of the tweet being replied to.may be empty

conversationId.description: The ID of the conversation the tweet is part of.may be empty

inReplyToUserId.description: The ID of the user being replied to.may be empty

inReplyToUsername.description: The username of the user being replied to.may be empty

author.description: The user who posted the tweet

entities.description: The entities in the tweet.eg. hashtags,urls,mentions

quoted_tweet.description: The tweet being quoted.may be null

retweeted_tweet.description: The tweet being retweeted.may be null

id_str.description: The ID of the user being mentioned

name.description: The name of the user being mentioned

screen_name.description: The screen name of the user being mentioned

tag.description: Custom tag to identify the rule.Max length is 255

value.description: Rule to filter tweets.eg "from:elonmusk OR from:kaitoeasyapi".Max length is 255

interval_seconds.description: Interval to check tweets.Min value is 100.Max value is 86400
